sectionName: GMAT Quantitative Reasoning - Full Section Practice (21 Questions)
testDescription: This full-length section contains 21 unused questions from the Official Guide, representing a complete GMAT Quantitative section experience. Questions span authentic difficulty levels with balanced distribution, providing realistic practice for final test preparation under timed conditions.
skillsAssessed: Rate, time, and work problem applications
Number theory and perfect number properties
Complex word problem translation and setup

questions.questionText: Working at a constant rate, a copy machine makes 20 copies of a one-page document per minute. If the machine works at this constant rate, how many hours does it take to make 4,800 copies of a one-page document?
If x, y, and k are positive and x is less than y, then (x+k)/(y+k) is

options.E: less than x/y or greater than x/y, depending on the value of k

questions.questionText: To order certain plants from a catalog, it costs $3.00 per plant, plus a 5 percent sales tax, plus $6.95 for shipping and handling regardless of the number of plants ordered. If Company C ordered these plants from the catalog at the total cost of $69.95, how many plants did Company C order?

A certain financial analyst defines the "volatility" of a stock during a given week to be the result of the following procedure: find the absolute value of the difference in the stock's closing price for each pair of consecutive days in the week and then find the average (arithmetic mean) of these 4 values. What is the volatility of Stock X during the week shown in the table? (Monday: 21, Tuesday: 19, Wednesday: 22, Thursday: 24(1/2), Friday: 23)
Of the following, which is least?

Each of the 20 employees at Company J is to receive an end-of-year bonus this year. Agnes will receive a larger bonus than any other employee, but only $500 more than Cheryl will receive. None of the employees will receive a smaller bonus than Cheryl. If the amount of money to be distributed in bonuses at Company J this year totals $60,000, what is the largest bonus Agnes can receive?
If r and s are positive integers such that (2^r)(4^s) = 16, then 2r + s =

A company sells radios for $15.00 each. It costs the company $14.00 per radio to produce 1,000 radios and $13.50 per radio to produce 2,000 radios. How much greater will the company's gross profit be from the production and sale of 2,000 radios than from the production and sale of 1,000 radios?

A company sells radios for $15.00 each. It costs the company $14.00 per radio to produce 1,000 radios and $13.50 per radio to produce 2,000 radios. How much greater will the company's gross profit be from the production and sale of 2,000 radios than from the production and sale of 1,000 radios?

The product of 3,305 and the 1-digit integer x is a 5-digit integer. The units (ones) digit of the product is 5 and the hundreds digit is y. If A is the set of all possible values of x and B is the set of all possible values of y, then which of the following gives the members of A and B?
Two numbers differ by 2 and sum to S. Which of the following is the greater of the numbers in terms of S?
A rope 20.6 meters long is cut into two pieces. If the length of one piece of rope is 2.8 meters shorter than the length of the other, what is the length, in meters, of the longer piece of rope?
If x = -|w|, which of the following must be true?

At the opening of a trading day at a certain stock exchange, the price per share of stock K was $8. If the price per share of stock K was $9 at the closing of the day, what was the percent increase in the price per share of stock K for that day?
When the positive integer k is divided by the positive integer n, the remainder is 11. If k/n = 81.2, what is the value of n?

Of all the students in a certain dormitory, 1/2 are first-year students and the rest are second-year students. If 4/5 of the first-year students have not declared a major and if the fraction of second-year students who have declared a major is 3 times the fraction of first-year students who have declared a major, what fraction of all the students in the dormitory are second-year students who have not declared a major?

A certain manufacturer sells its product to stores in 113 different regions worldwide, with an average (arithmetic mean) of 181 stores per region. If last year these stores sold an average of 51,752 units of the manufacturer's product per store, which of the following is closest to the total number of units of the manufacturer's product sold worldwide last year?

A positive integer n is a perfect number provided that the sum of all the positive factors of n, including 1 and n, is equal to 2n. What is the sum of the reciprocals of all the positive factors of the perfect number 28?

If the variables X, Y, and Z take on only the values 10, 20, 30, 40, 50, 60, or 70 with frequencies indicated by the shaded regions above, for which of the frequency distributions is the mean equal to the median?
What is the remainder when 3^24 is divided by 5?

Becky rented a power tool from a rental shop. The rent for the tool was $12 for the first hour and $3 for each additional hour. If Becky paid a total of $27, excluding sales tax, to rent the tool, for how many hours did she rent it?

The formula above gives the contribution C, in dollars, to a certain profit-sharing plan for a participant with a salary of s dollars. How many more dollars is the contribution for a participant with a salary of $70,000 than for a participant with a salary of $50,000?
